title: AMA Request: CertainlyT (Kalista, Yasuo, Thresh, Darius)
body:
During his time with Riot Games, CertainlyT has become Riot's most aggressive and controversial champion designer. His designs are known for pushing the envelope and redefining just how much stuff can be packed into a champion's kit. 

For the same reason, CertainlyT's designs have been highly controversial on the forums. Many of them are viewed as "overloaded" or "toxic" by players, and Yasuo, Thresh, and Darius have all been the victim of long series of nerfs at some point in their lifetimes. With all that said, however, CertainlyT's champions always have a completely different feel compared to other champions released in the same era, and question our assumptions of "what can possibly be balanced in League of Legends". 

Can we get the man himself to talk about his design philosophy and discuss the future additions and reworks of League on Gameplay and Balance sometime?

replies.body:
I think the real problem is that champions like Yasuo exist in the same game as champions like Olaf.

There is a VERY clear level of depth/thought/*tangible* differences and what have you between the two champs, and this will always be present as long as CertainlyT's champions exist in the same space as these...less up to date champions.

I imagine one day in the very far future that champions at least on the level of Yasuo are par for the course for League of Legends, and champions like our current iteration of Olaf wouldn't even be imagined to be in the game.

Yes, right here. It's not that he's creating bad champions, per se, but his design is way too far out there compared to the existing champs. It's cool that he's making all of these nice mechanics, but as I said in another post somewhere, these mechanics are causing other champions to be pushed off a ledge and forgotten in a dumpster (Mordekaiser being the prime example).

I think the main problem is Riot refusing to give minor updates to these old champions to make them feel good, and instead waiting years to fully rework them from the ground up while in the meantime they rot in the corner.
Aren't they starting to do that right now with champions like Singed and Tristana?
Actually they are doing those works right now, but they want the updates to really feel good and be balancable in the long run.
Why do people consider Mordekaiser to be weak?  In exchange for lack of mobility, he has one of the strongest ults in the game.  It's easily countered, but when it works, it wins fights on its own.

Yes his ult is powerful but in exchange you have the only champion in game without any mobility (speed boosts and dashes) or cc. His only function is a sometimes lane bully that is the easiest ganked champ in game. 

I can pretty much garentee that if you took every pro player and gave them a choice of Morde or any other champ in this game, they would take the second choice simply because every other champ has more options when played than him.  

He can't push without making a glowing sign of himself saying "kill me please". It doesn't matter how strong an ability is if the champion in every other respect is near useless. He can't even build tank since if he does, he would be literally be meaningless in fights due to no damage or cc.
I guess you don't remember Overpow carrying a game as Morde two splits back :)

CertaintlyT champions are all "trap champions",the reason people like that is exactly the reason people hate them(well I'm mostly talking about kalista/yasuo/zed whereas thresh and darius have different,lesser issues),and if people would actually play to win it would create a situation where everyone suffers.

As to why everyone suffers: What would you pick if you were expecting a yasuo/kalista/zed pick?(note that they aren't limited to certaintlyT champs,fizz is another obvious example),basically something highly reliable either in defensive or offensive capabilities, annie,zilean,janna,kayle,ryze all come to mind,now there are two important things which these champions share:
1)Most people would consider them boring,and don't find playing them very enjoyable,the fact yasou/etc force people to play things they don't want to isn't very positive.
2)When properly countered by these champions the yasuo/kalista/zed players aren't having much fun either,there they just can't "cheat"(I like this term because skillshot reliability isn't balanced around their insane mobility, so the odds in such a matchup are heavily stacked in their favor) their way out of abilities,and in fact the binary nature of these champions isn't practicularly fun to play against as other things as well,but much better than playing as yasuo/etc vs them.

As it is they are fun because people enjoy hard countering matchups,they think to themselves "hurr durr I'm outplay lux she can't land a single thing on me she so bad lol im so gud",then when they get matched against annie/kayle "omfg fucking counter pickers why can't they pick something I can spam mobility to avoid all of their abilities".

So overall,They further invalidate champions who are already in a bad spot,they devolve gameplay by forcing highly reliable binary picks as other things simply do not work against them,people enjoy them because they enjoy rofl stomping people who pick off meta champions.

As to darius,ironically too binary,his kit doesn't have enough meaning he will just be some combination of a scary lane bully and jungler fodder,riot doesn't like champions who need to rely on being ganked to be handled,so he isn't allowed to be very strong.

Thresh is far too generalistic,has been overpowered since release,it's very hard to allow him to be strong without making him stronger than every other pick,which is mostly what he has been doing since release.
But the thing is, Yasuo isn't overpowered at all anymore....so can you take him off the list? He literally automatically loses lane until he gets 2 completed items...

First of all as a sort of disclaimer I am not too sure about yasuo current power level,though I tend to agree with you that he isn't overpowered anymore.

His kit is still hyper mobile nonsense which HAS to be counterpicked(though most meta champions work against it,which is tied to the reason why they are meta,these sort of champions devolve gameplay,focusing everything around themselves) either with some other hyper mobile nonsense or something highly reliable and binary,that will never change,he still facerolls skillshot reliant champions same as always,he cannot be removed from the list as the list is basically defined by champions who have an easy time avoiding skillshots,if yasuo isn't there then who is?

Yet he is only in that state because of his latest nerf, before that happened all he needed to do to start carrying was buy static shiv because of his stupid number of passives. 

With the huge armor pen on his ult and double crit passive he is simply too easy to snowball with. The ult means that buying armor is near useless and the double crit means that instead of actually having to buy lots of items to reach late game power he does it in one purchase. 

Unless he remains extremely weak his overloaded kit will always leave him op.

That may be true, but League exists as is with the older champs. New champions need to be made with older champs in mind, you can't just say, "Wouldn't it be fun if all champs were like this?" because not all champs are like that. New champions have to be able to coexist with old champs like Olaf and Morde. If all new champs are made with a lot in their kits, then old champs whose kits are focused on being very strong in one or two aspects get overshadowed. Sure the new champs are fun 'cause they can do anything, but then it's not fun to play against when using old champs where you just can't do as much as they can.

I'm not so sure it's true that "new champions need to be made with older champs in mind". It is a fact that LoL has grown and changed since it was born. What is a suitable degree of mindfulness for older champions. It seems to be your opinion that they haven't been mindful enough. If older champs are less fun, though, then limiting themselves to the same design constraints that resulted in those champs could be shackling themselves to the mistakes of their own inexperience.

Consider Magic: The Gathering as an example. It took many years for them to figure out how to design with a consistent power level. Nowadays, there are cards from days past that would be considered completely unplayable. The game is better for the designers having recognized those cards as mistakes and making better cards, though. Likewise, as the champion roster grows, I expect new designs to reflect greater knowledge and experience. It would be awfully nice if older champs eventually get updates to benefit from that experience as well. Even if they don't, however, I'm happier to see the game grow and evolve rather than remain chained to its past.

CertainlyT's champs are certainly very fun; the sheer number of people who want to play Yasuo/Zed/Thresh should indicate that. However, I feel he makes two huge mistakes in his champ design (either that or the people who balance his champs make the mistakes): He undervalues mobility and seems to add random stats to his champs to make them 'good'

So mobility should be obvious. Kalista gets a dash after every auto, Yasuo is can have up to 7 dashes in a laning environment, Zed gets two gapclosers and can jump back to each one. However, I don't feel they particularly pay for this mobility in most ways. Kalista's relatively weak early game, when her auto is incredibly long, but as she gets attack speed that stops becoming an issue. Yasuo's squishy as hell nowadays, but that's because he has a personal shield that he doesn't have to do anything for besides 'move' and his windwall, which can completely shut down some champs. Zed can put down a load of damage on you and be out before you can kill him. (Though I feel Zed's a special case, in that he's even more binary than most assassins. Laning against Zed is incredibly painful after six if you can't counter-burst or escape from him, but when you buy a Zhonya's, you can completely shut him down.) That's not new for Riot, though, so I am loathe to apply that specifically to CertainlyT.

My major problem with CertainlyT's champs is that they get a lot of things in a single kit. In addition to a vision spell that's about equal to Ashe and Quinn, Kalista gets % max hp magic damage. Zed gets free AD, and runs off of energy. Thresh has one of the only ally reposition spells in the game, plus a stun, plus a minor knockback, plus a giant slow, and can get to much higher levels of armor than a normal tank support can. Darius gets all three damage types and armor pen, for some reason. Yasuo gets two passives, one of which is the stupidest in the game, plus free bonus armor penetration on his ult (which isn't that hard to activate, in a game with as many displacements as League.)

By themselves, either of those things is annoying, but manageable. It's when they're combined that I start to have an issue.

Honestly, I would love past champs to be updated and champs like ceetainlyt's champs to keep coming out. They have extremely unique kits that are absolutely the most fun to play. And I don't mean that thwy are fun cause they are overloaded in anyway but because they offer a lot more fun and diversity in how you can play the champs compared to old ones
